extendedInfo.description: Just a few years after its release, Carcassonne became a modern classic and a must-play. Turn by turn, the players create a landscape by placing tiles with roads, cities, fields, and cloisters. The players deploy their followers - knights, monks, thieves, or farmers - to earn points. The player with the most points after the final scoring wins the game. The ever-changing landscape makes each game a new experience. With the official expansion "The River II" and 12 challenges, it never gets old. You can play against clever AI opponents or with up to 4 other players in a local multiplayer match. Features:- Mobile version of the award-winning tile-based board game "Carcassonne"- Includes the official expansion "The River II"- Features 12 challenges- Clever AI opponents with individual strategies- Local multiplayer mode for up to 5 players- Tutorial and manual for beginners- Language Support: English, German, French, SpanishPress:PocketGamer.co.uk - MOBILE GAME OF THE YEAR 2012PocketGamer: Readers' Choice Awards - MOBILE GAME OF THE YEAR 2012AndroidMag.de: MULTIPLAYER GAME OF THE YEAR 2012PocketGamer.co.uk - Silver Award: "A great adaptation of a great board game" PlayAndroid.com - 24/30: "This really is one of those must-haves that youâll keep returning to, time and time and again." - "I had never played the game before, but now Iâm hooked."MeAndMyDroid.com - 4.5/5: "Graphically Carcassonne is excellent for a board game and its thematic audio certainly adds atmosphere." - "4.5/5 stars for a well-crafted board game"Gamezebo.com - 4/5: "Carcassonne for Android is a great adaptation of the popular board game"DroidGamers.com: "If you looking for a enjoyable, easy to play, well built, inexpensive strategy game, I recommend you download Carcassonne for Android in the Market."BestAppEver Awards: "Best Android Board Games - Second Place" -------Follow us on Twitter: www.twitter.com/exozet_games

reviews.title: Classic!
reviews.comment: Simple but addictive and challenging. Love this game. If you like Settlers of Catan you will enjoy this.
reviews.author: Chris Hayne

reviews.title: Update compatibility
reviews.comment: Had update compatibility issues with release 7, but the developer stepped in quickly to resolve them. Graphics don\'t look that great on the Note 10.1 when zoomed out - like it is not properly optimised for the device resolution, but gameplay is fine.
reviews.author: Jacques Nel

reviews.title: Great fun so far
reviews.comment: Lots of fun and pretty smart AI so u wont get bored
reviews.author: Ryan PPool

reviews.title: OK, but lot\'s of room for improvement
reviews.comment: The game looks and plays nicely. However, poor AI, no campaign, and no extensions make 3.99\342\202\254 look rather steep. Please improve.
reviews.author: Hans-Peter Loeb

reviews.title: Wow amazing adaptation from the amazing board game!
reviews.comment: I really like the game. It is fun and challenging  I just wish they could add the expansions the board game has since they add a lot the the game experience and makes it a more challenging and overall a even better game. They should at least add the Inns and Cathedral and the Traders and Builders expansions.
reviews.author: Thai Beamonte

reviews.title: Pretty good, but AI doesn\'t team up
reviews.comment: Addictive. Pretty good on two player, but AI seems to prefer placing tiles randomly rather than working as a team with or against me. Would be great to have a \"deal?\" button for when the ai gets a piece that I want :-)
reviews.author: Katherine Allen

reviews.title: Love it, but...
reviews.comment: Can we ever expect online mode? And even more important, is there plan to make more expansions, cause TBH river is worse off them all. Thanks.
reviews.author: Jasenko Pasic

reviews.title: Seriously flawed
reviews.comment: I want to love this app. It\'s a great representation of the board game. However, when the game tallies points it often doesn\'t reward me my points. It will show a + next to a number of points, take up my person, then not award those points. Sometimes it doesn\'t finish taking up all of my people before giving the total. It always finishes the total of the AI players. It\'s extremely frustrating. I also would like the ability to play against live players.
reviews.author: Meg Callender

reviews.title: Good, room for improvement.
reviews.comment: It works to get my Carcassonne fix, but the animations and particularly the AI opponents are rather childish.  Also, I bought it under the impression that local multiplayer meant Bluetooth or Wifi, not passing the tablet between players.  My mistake, but I hope someone reading this avoids making the same error.
reviews.author: John Shanks

reviews.title: A battery hog...
reviews.comment: This is a great game but with limited AI, it\'s just not as good as playing humans if you\'re a serious player (winning all the time gets a bit boring). Worse still, it really drains the battery of my Galaxy S3 far quicker than any other app I own, meaning I am loath to play.  If you\'re new to the game, it would be a great introduction and to hone strategies inbetween games with friends.
reviews.author: vaughan connolly

reviews.title: Best game ever
reviews.comment: I own several versions of this board game. This is great to have as a smartphone app! Quick game that requires some strategic thinking. Never gets boring!
reviews.author: Steven R. Colson

reviews.title: Would love to have more expansions.
reviews.comment: Almost as fun as the real game. Works #1 on my Nexus 7 and Nexus 4. That\'s the thing, every apps runs great on Google Nexus hardware.   Only thing I\'m missing is the expansions, so I took a star off. Would be great if they added Inns and Cathedrals + Builders and Traders.
reviews.author: Kevin Turcotte

reviews.title: Good but basic flaws
reviews.comment: So far so good as a game of Carcassonne, but why the hell did they forget to put in an undo button?! The way it plays means it\'s very easy to place tile accidentally but then you have to come out of the game to the main menu and resume just to undo. I\'m also not entirely sure if all my end game points are being added up.
reviews.author: Tom Gentry

reviews.title: Great game, wish the AI were a little better
reviews.comment: Really smart interface and good graphics.  The AI is ruthless and pretty smart.  I wish that it were a little more nuanced -- it would be great if a couple of AI\'s teamed up from time to time, or even teamed up with the player.
reviews.author: Phill Williams

reviews.title: EPIC GAME - Noob to Hardcore friendly
reviews.comment: The greatest board game ever. People can play it in 5 minutes and it has massive replayability.   Plus party mode :)
reviews.author: Jeremy John Shimmin

reviews.title: Crashes and wipes all memory constantly.
reviews.comment: I play this a lot, and it is a good implementation of the base game. I would love it if there were some expansions. Also, for the love of g_d fix the stability problems. The game will, roughly once every 3 weeks, crash and when it restarts, will have taken all settings and saved information with it. Please fix.
reviews.author: Yonatan Bryant

reviews.title: Good but could be so much better
reviews.comment: Good conversion of the fantastic board game. But long term playability against computer opponents could be improved. Recent updates made viewing my Nexus 4 much better. However it would be so much better it there were more of the expansion packs included and if there were more objective badges (& perhaps more levels to the existing ones). Perhaps the expansion packs could be earnt through achievements?
reviews.author: Sam Moss
